response15.text:
# PS3 Hardware Players:

Greyed out custom songs? Completely disable Parental Controls on your PS3 and it might fix it! By default, this is set to level 9, which is not enough to allow "Not Rated" songs like many customs, and even Rock Band Network.

XMB: [ Settings ] -> [ Security Settings ] -> [ Parental Control ] -> [ **Off** ]

response19.text:
Error: User provided no rpcs3.log.
To upload a log, type `!log` and:
* Run into the crash or problem first then close out RPCS3.
* **DO NOT REOPEN IT!**
* Send `RPCS3.log` or `RPCS3.log.gz`
* On Windows, it's in the folder you have RPCS3 in.
* On Linux, it's in `~/.cache/rpcs3/`.
* On macOS, it's in `~/Library/Caches/rpcs3`. (May require you to show hidden folders)
The bot should be able to process your log to help you understand what may be wrong.

response21.text:
# RPCS3 High Memory Mode #
This will increase your song limit to 16,000 and should allow for better stability and less crashes by allowing RB3 to use extra memory in your system.

Step 1: Right click Rock Band 3 and select `Change Custom Configuration`
Step 2: Enable `Debug Console Mode` under the Advanced tab
Step 3: Download the dx_high_memory.dta file at the bottom of this post into: `dev_hdd0/game/BLUS30463/USRDIR`

*if you already installed the pre-made recommended configuration from the rb3pc guide, you will already have this*

DO NOT ATTEMPT TO USE THIS ON HARDWARE

response29.text:
Batch recompile, Load a song, and Batch process, all rebuild the songs from scratch, losing all metadata originally associated with the song.
This means the song will not be correct for leaderboards, online play, or dx song upgrades (harmonies, pro upgrades, rb4 chart updates).
**Never recompile songs already existing in Rock Band format back to Rock Band.**

response49.text:
Wii Customs Part 1. Everything in this post is a one-time thing:
- You need an SD card formatted FAT32. You cannot store the game itself on the SD card.
- You will need to use a CIOS or patched IOS to play customs. (CIOS only, if using Wii U. Most guides install the correct CIOS for RB3 in slot 249. Use a loader to force that IOS to be used when launching the game. CIOS USB support can be iffy.)
- If you're on a USA console (PAL console we'll have to dig up the proper files), I'm going to recommend packing customs in sZHE. Go to this page: https://gitlab.com/rock-band-customs/wii-vwii-dolphin/-/tree/DLC_Packers_NTSC, create a folder for packing customs on your computer and download all the files inside the "sZHE" folder on this page and place them inside. Also download all files within the "basefiles" and place them inside that folder as well. Also go into the ticket wads folder and download sZHE.wad.
- On your Wii, you need to extract your console keys with a homebrew called xyzzy mod. You also want to install the sZHE wad with your favourite wad manager, such as wiimodlite. But don't just install it, also uninstall it, and then install it again. If then you see error -1022, it probably worked.
- In Rock Band 3, you need to enable SD Card mode. If it doesn't automatically ask you, try enabling it in the options, and if it says "An Unknown Error Occurred" then you need to have downloaded something from the Wii Shop at some point. The Skyward Sword save fix channel is still available to purchase. You can delete the channel after, you just have to download something. If visiting the shop asks you to update, do it I guess?, and hopefully nothing breaks.
- On your computer look into the keys.txt you extracted and find your Console id (NOT ng_id), an 8-character hexadecimal string, and paste that into the ng_id.txt file in your packer. Make sure it's only those 8 characters, no extra new lines or spaces or anything.

Wii Customs Part 2. This post you'll do on a per-song basis. I'm assuming you will find customs as xbox con files.
- You need a program called "Nautilus". Run the con file for the custom you want to add through the Wii converter. This program has a few bugs it'll probably do a good enough job for about 90% of cases. The specifics of how you will perfectly convert every type of con file you might find lying around is too much to cover. It's possible to convert just about anything, but some knowhow might be required.
- It will output two folders; put them into your packing folder. You need to chose a slot number, start by using slot 002 for the meta folder for your first song, and 003 for the song folder. Rename the folder to change the first 3-digit number to the slots you've chosen. There's an 8-digit number that also has to be renamed, in sZHE (or the other custom generation, sZGE) this number is always a direct conversion from the 3-digit decimal number to 8-digit hexidecimal.
- Go into the meta file and find songs.dta and edit it with your text editor. You need to edit the filepath in the 'name' near the top of the file to match the generation (sZHE in your case) and slot number of the meta folder (002 for your first song) (the Wii converter defaults to sZAE and 000). Also run rb3wiicustoms manager after completing these steps. It will pop up and alert you if the decimal and hexadecimal numbers don't match.
- Then you pack the song by first running packerscriptcreator, and then running the packdlc.bat file that it edits for you.
- Place the .bin files that are created onto the correct place on your sd card, private/wii/data/sZHE. Any app files that were created in the packing process can be deleted, but be careful not to delete 00000001.app.

And that's it, hopefully the song will be playable now if you put the SD card in and go in-game.

There's a part 3 that goes over the finer specifics of converting cons to Wii but nobody has time to write that tbh.

Good luck!

response56.text:
Dolphin NAND and 64gb SD card with all DLC preinstalled to the SD card
This is because Dolphin and dlc is so annoyingly confusing.
This should even work with the vanilla game.
The vanilla game cant transfer content to the SD if the nand is full.
Dolphin will install wads to the nand, there isnt a good way to install to the SD.
Then you get locked out of saving and caching in game, and there is nothing you can do.
and one pack specifically is even more annoying to install.
This has it all pre-done so you dont have to suffer as I have suffered.
https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/19x_Y_1HgZ9mj7iJSfVEADRyrsigz0Rdi?usp=sharing

response57.text:
Xbox 360 hardware:
### Note: This requires RB3Enhanced to be installed
There are a couple of steps to get this working:
* **Download rb3e_index.html below** and put it in the same place as RB3 on the Xbox.
* **Grab the latest RB3E nightly (NoDebug)** [RB3Enhanced Nightly](https://nightly.link/RBEnhanced/RB3Enhanced/workflows/build/master)
* Add this to your `rb3.ini`
```
[HTTP]
EnableHTTPServer = true
```
In the DX repo **on the develop branch** in the `scripts` folder, you will want to add a new line to your `config.ini`, or copy from `config_default.ini` (replacing with the IP to your Xbox)
```
xbox_console_ip = 192.168.0.36
```
When set, the Rich Presence script will attempt to connect to the Xbox when launched first, and if that fails, it will automatically fall back to the RPCS3 Rich Presence like normal.
To run Rich Presence, in a command prompt inside the `scripts` folder, run:
```
python dx_discordrp.py
```
You will need a couple of packages to run this script:
```
pip install pypresence requests
```

response58.text:
Glitching/teleporting instruments is a vanilla Rock Band 3 bug present in **PS3**, made worse in **RPCS3**.
Linked below is a file you can extract and patch your
**Vanilla Base RB3 extracted disc game files**
to fix the issue for almost all guitars and basses.
Also below is a very detailed guide of items that **ARE** affected by the teleporting. Besides the clear microphone, this is a list of items to avoid.
Currently the only fix for microphones is using the transparent microphone.
[PS3 Guitar/Bass Patch Files](https://github.com/hmxmilohax/rock-band-3-deluxe/raw/main/dependencies/ps3_patcher/rb3_ps3_guitar_glitch_fix.7z)
https://rb3pc.milohax.org/trbl_teleprob

response68.text:
* Rock Band 1/2 DLC
`/Hdd1/Content/0000000000000000/45410829/00000001`
`/Hdd1/Content/0000000000000000/45410829/00000002`
* Rock Band 3 DLC
`/Hdd1/Content/0000000000000000/45410914/00000001`
`/Hdd1/Content/0000000000000000/45410914/00000002`

CON files go in `00000001`
LIVE files go in `00000002`

Use RBtoUSB from [Nautilus](https://nemosnautilus.com/nautilus/) to place files in the correct place for you on a flash drive if unsure

response69.text:
# __Liveless Setup (RB3)__ #

Required Rock Band 3 Enhanced
(Install instructions included in a .txt file):
https://rb3e.rbenhanced.rocks/download.html

Along with the latest enhanced nightly, `RB3Enhanced-Xbox-NoDebug`
https://nightly.link/RBEnhanced/RB3Enhanced/workflows/build/master


In the rb3.ini remove the # from both STUNServer and STUNServerPort and add:
```ini
[Xbox360]
LivelessAddress = liveless-testing.ipg.pw

[Network]
EnableUPnP = true
```
*If you're having trouble connecting to other users or experience ghost players (seeing their highway but score not go up), port forward 9103 UDP to your Xbox*

Both Liveless & Leaderboards will NOT work with the following:
* Stealth servers
* Freestyle Dash 3

In Dashlaunch, make sure of the following:
liveblock on, sockpatch on, fakelive off

## __Leaderboards__ ##

Replace the `[GoCentral]` field with the following:

```ini
[GoCentral]
# Enables redirecting Rock Central servers to a custom server.
# This also re-enables Audition Mode if enabled.
# (This setting is ignored if using an Xbox 360 and connected to official services.)
EnableGoCentral = true
# The IP address of the GoCentral server.
GoCentralAddress = 45.33.44.103
```

response75.text:
# Modo de alta memoria para RPCS3 #
Esto va aumentar el numero de canciones a 16.000 y tambien ayudada con la estabilidad de Rock Band 3 gracias a la memoria adicional.

Paso 1: Haz click en Rock Band 3 y selecciona `Change Custom Configuration`
Paso 2: En la pestaña de `Advanced`, activa `Debug Console Mode`
Paso 3: Descarga el archivo `dx_high_memory.dta` abajo de este mensaje
Paso 4: Haz click derecho en Rock Band 3 en RPCS3 y luego en `Open Folder > Open Game Data Folder`
Paso 5: Arrastra el archivo `dx_high_memory.dta` dentro de `USRDIR`

*Si usaste una Configuracion Rapida de la guia rb3pc, ya tienes esto.*

NO INTENTES USAR ESTE ARCHIVO EN UNA CONSOLA

response76.text:

* Ve a la carpeta donde tienes RPCS3
* Entra a la carpeta `config` y luego en `custom_configs`
* Para Rock Band 2, manda `config_BLUS30147.yml`
* Para Rock Band 3, manda `config_BLUS30463.yml`

response80.text:
Manda un historial (log) para ver que paso con el emulador.
Para subir un historial (log), escribe `!log` y:
* Trata de replicar el problema o crasheo y cierra RPCS3.
* **¡NO LO ABRAS DE VUELTA!**
* Manda el archivo `RPCS3.log` o `RPCS3.log.gz`
* En Windows, esta en la carpeta donde tienes RPCS3.
* En Linux, esta en `~/.cache/rpcs3/`.
* En macOS, esta en `~/Library/Caches/rpcs3`. (Es posible que necitas activar archivos escondidos)
Despues de esto, el bot va a analizar el historial para ver donde esta el problema.

response82.text:
Las opciones de `Batch recompile`, `Load a song` o `Batch process` reconstruyes las canciones, borrando todo los datos especiales de Rock Band. 
Esto resulta en una perdida de ID, cual hace que funcionen en linea y con los tableros de calificaciones. Igualmente, no tendras mejoras de Deluxe (armonias, mejoras Pro, actualizaciones de RB4). 
**NUNCA uses esas opciones si vas a instalar canciones en formato Rock Band en un juego de Rock Band.** Usa la opcion de `Quick convert/pack`

response85.text: I feel like practice mode is a way of cheating. You play to play the game, not to FC everything. And you can still FC it by practising the song all over again. Practice mode just takes away the momentum and the charm. It may be frustrating, but that's how it is.
